image.altText: Two flags on a golf course with large buildings from the city in the background.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Aboriginal Affairs minister has imposed 31 strict conditions on the government's planned redevelopment of the North Adelaide golf course.

title.children: Strict conditions imposed on future LIV Golf site

image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coroner has recommended changes to national driving fitness standards following the death of cyclist Robert Hill who was hit and killed by a partially blind driver on a country highway seven years ago.

title.children: Inquest recommends reforms after cyclist killed by partially blind driver

image.altText: The top of a swing pole showing a hole where a bolt should be

props.synopsis: South Australia's Education Department has been fined $225,000 after a student at a special school fell from a swing which had not had a comprehensive safety inspection for eight years.

title.children: Teen's playground fall costs department $225K fine for failed inspections

image.altText: Outback South Australia during the search for Gus.

props.synopsis: SA Police and ADF personnel have concluded a four-day renewed search for four-year-old Gus, as a missing persons advocate speaks out about the emotional impact of such cases on all families who have experienced the disappearance of a loved one.

title.children: Expanded search for Gus ends as missing persons advocate speaks out

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt runs up to kick a goat kid

props.synopsis: Jet Jai Johnson is released from prison two-and-a-half months into his 14-month sentence after telling a court spending his 21st birthday behind bars was a wake-up call.Â

title.children: Animal cruelty offender released after 'wake-up call' 21st behind bars

image.altText: a road sign with clouds and trees in the background

props.synopsis: The South Australian ombudsman says Southern Mallee Council Mayor Ron Valentine improperly used his position to gain an advantage for himself in the recruitment of a CEO in 2023.

title.children: Council mayor apologises for misconduct in CEO recruitment process

image.altText: A large concrete sign with letters saying National Gallery of Australia.

props.synopsis: The National Gallery will host an exhibition of art from the Aá¹angu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands three years after a video appearing to show a non-Aboriginal assistant helping to paint an artwork led to it being postponed.

title.children: National Gallery to host postponed APY artists exhibition after three years

image.altText: A moddy picture of a Broken Hill streetscape

props.synopsis:
In October 2024, thousands of households and businesses in far west NSW were hit by a catastrophic power outage that lasted for weeks, and the fallout continues.

Â

title.children: Outback communities reflect on actions taken one year on from power outages

image.altText: a blurred photo of a six-year-old boy with a shaved head

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman has pleaded guilty to 11 charges after she faked her six-year-old son's cancer diagnosis in a bid to raise more than $11,000.

title.children: Mother who faked son's cancer diagnosis pleads guilty to 11 charges

image.altText: The top of a police car with the word 'Police' on it. Some city buildings are in the background

props.synopsis: A man has been restrained by passengers on a full bus during peak hour in Adelaide's north-east after allegedly being "aggressive and abusive", a witness says.

title.children: 'Aggressive' man restrained during peak hour bus ride, passenger claims

image.altText: Screenshot of Elle Barker's video talking to her followers.

props.synopsis: A South Australian influencer has used her TikTok to warn others to be careful about sharing personal information in public, after a stranger memorised her phone number while she recited it to a cashier.Â

title.children: Influencer issues warning after stranger memorises phone number at check-out

image.altText: A white building with green signs across the roof line which read: Ultra Tune and Auto Service Centre

props.synopsis:
An Ultra Tune franchisee who left two apprentices unsupervised while he holidayed interstate has been indefinitely prohibited from having trainees over supervision concerns.

Â

title.children: Franchisee's holiday leads to trainee ban amid safety concerns

image.altText: A man wearing a cap with a red beard and his face covered in sunscreen holds a baby .

props.synopsis: Mitch McKenny is unlikely to run again after spending four weeks running from Broken Hill to Newcastle, including the last 380 kilometres with severe pain in his hip.Â

title.children: 'Marathon Mitch' manages to finish 1,100km charity run with broken hip

image.altText: Penfolds bottles on a shelf.

props.synopsis: Cheaper bulk wine has been struggling in the market, but now even prestigious labels like Penfolds are feeling the pinch off the back of changing drinking habits and a reported crackdown on lavish banquets for civil servants.

title.children: Australian wine labels feeling the pinch as Chinese buy and drink less

image.altText: A tomahawk missile fired from a US naval warship.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump threatened to send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if Russia did not return to peace talks, but analysts say the long-range weapons are not the game-changer they are made out to be.

title.children: US dangled threat of Tomahawks for Ukraine, then Russia called to negotiate

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will "no doubt" use a meeting with Donald Trump next week to discuss critical minerals, the treasurer says as he dismisses a call for Australia to "decouple" with China over rare earth materials.Â

title.children: Chalmers says Australia can be a 'reliable' critical minerals partner with US

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus touches her hair and smiles

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus has spoken publicly for the first time after abruptly retiring from professional swimming at just 25, revealing the reasons behind her decision.

title.children: Titmus admits she lost the 'fire in the belly' before shock retirement

image.altText: A man in a suit with a blue tie sits inside a hall.

props.synopsis: An army colonel who seized power in a military coup has been sworn in as Madagascar's new leader, after a sudden power grab that ousted the president and sent him fleeing from the country.

title.children: Madagascar military leader sworn in as president after coup

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

title.children: Man who murdered Canberra Zoo co-worker 'remains infatuated' with her

image.altText: A sunset view of an ocean, with a boat and still water.

props.synopsis: Unseasonable temperatures have lasted along the eastern seaboard for weeks â which has Sydney, and possibly Brisbane, on track to observe their warmest October on record.

title.children: Two of Australia's capital cities on track for warmest October on record

image.altText: A Palestinian man with a beard sits unsmiling in a chair.

props.synopsis: Shadi Abu Sido spent 18 months in Israeli detention believing that his entire family had been killed in Gaza. Then he was reunited with his wife and children in Gaza.

title.children: 'That scene was indescribable': Shadi Abu Sido returns home to Gaza after months in prison

image.altText: elderly man with white hair, busy eyebrows, white shirt, blue tie and navy jacket, gestures with hands while explaining.

props.synopsis: Known for his landmark apology for Japan's World War II aggression and the phrases "deep remorse" and "heartfelt apology", Tomiichi Murayama has died at a hospital in Oita City.

title.children: Former Japanese PM Murayama, famous for WWII apology, dies aged 101

image.altText: Ace Frehley on stage with his guitar and signature KISS makeup

props.synopsis: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.

title.children: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74

image.altText: Male fast bowler running and pointing in celebration of a wicket

props.synopsis: Scott Boland has produced a man-of-the-match performance, bowling Victoria to a 38-run win over New South Wales in their Sheffield Shield clash.

title.children: Boland builds towards Ashes with match-winning performance for Victoria

image.altText: Donald Trump holding up a model white monument

props.synopsis: The arch would stand at the Washington end of Memorial Bridge, which spans the Potomac River from Arlington, Virginia.

title.children: Trump's plan to build Paris-style arch next to Lincoln Memorial

image.altText: An older man in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Australia's defence force has had discussions with the Unted States to provide support for its Gaza peace plan but the government says no formal request has been made yet.Â

title.children: Defence in talks to assist Gaza peace plan but Australia says no request yet

image.altText: A screenshot of a black and white image of blazing boat on an ocean with the word 'unclassified' above it.

props.synopsis: A US strike against a suspected Venezuelan drug-smuggling vessel has left multiple survivors, as Venezuela's ambassador to the United Nations condemned the strikes as a "series of assassinations".

title.children: US strike on suspected Venezuelan drug boat 'extrajudicial executions'

image.altText: john Bolton dressed in dark suit and red tie speaking at a lecture with pen in his right hand

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's former national security adviser has been charged with storing top secret records at home and sharing classified information. Here's what we know.

title.children: Who is John Bolton and why has he fallen out with Trump?

image.altText: woman sitting at restaurant table on her phone

props.synopsis: Both people involved in a date are responsible for creating a safe environment, experts say. Â

title.children: How to make a first date safer and red flags to look out for

props.synopsis: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.Â

title.children: Race between Chalmers and Burke pits communicator against tactician

image.altText: Australian ODI cricketer Cam Green holds the ball in both hands as he prepares to throw the ball in to the wicketkeeper.

props.synopsis: Cameron Green has been ruled out of Australia's ODI series against India, just over a month out from the start of the Ashes series against England.

title.children: Green dealt further injury setback, in-form Labuschagne into ODI squad

image.altText: Batter players off his pads into the leg side, watches where the ball goes, along with the slip fielder behind

props.synopsis: Former Australia batter Nic Maddinson has revealed he underwent chemotherapy for testicular cancer.

title.children: Australia Test batter Nic Maddinson reveals testicular cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A skull lies among artefacts from World War Two under the water of Chuuk Lagoon in Micronesia.

props.synopsis: The Federated States of Micronesia's biggest tourism asset has become one of its largest threats, with as much as 22 million litres of oil from World War II shipwrecks slowly leaking into the ocean.

title.children: Micronesia's worst fears realised as WWII shipwrecks leak
